news_header: NATO's former Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg becomes the new chairman of the Munich Security Conference.
news_text: Jens Stoltenberg, who recently stepped down as NATO's Secretary General, will take on the role of chairman for the Munich Security Conference. This conference is one of the world's most significant events focusing on geopolitical and security policy, attracting over a hundred state leaders and ministers annually. Stoltenberg succeeds Christoph Heusgen, the former German UN ambassador and advisor to ex-Chancellor Angela Merkel.
